01x02.name: Frank
01x02.line: Robot, kick him in the knees. Bears have weak knees.

01x02.name: Frank
01x02.line: He should vibrate, 'cause the robot's full of radiation.

01x02.name: Frank
01x02.line: Yeah, that's it.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: Frank? How many bears did I say you could have?

01x02.name: Frank
01x02.line: One.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: And how many do you see here?

01x02.name: Frank
01x02.line: Um, four?

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: Save a little money for the rest of us, Frank.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: You can't spend a bunch of money on bear suits, that are only gonna be seen for like 25 seconds.

01x02.name: Frank
01x02.line: Liz, nobody's gonna believe that a killer robot, can get his ass kicked by one bear. It doesn't make any sense.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: You're trying to bring logic to the robot-bear sketch? You can't have four bears!

01x02.name: Frank
01x02.line: Well, how many can I keep?

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: One!

01x02.name: Frank
01x02.line: Sorry, guys. Sam, why don't you stay?

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: Who did my sudoku puzzle? I have been looking forward to this puzzle all morning.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: Hey, Liz, could you come up to my office, when you have a free moment?

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: I never have a free moment, Jack... never, ever.

01x02.name: Frank
01x02.line: Really punch him, like karate.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: Are you familiar with the Japanese art of reiki?

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: No.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: It is the laying on of hands in order to improve one's life.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: Hmm. How does you life improve? Do the hands have money in them?

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: Human contact is important, Lemon.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: I can tell from your stress level, that you have not been touched in any way in quite some time... not caressed, not massaged, not even groped on the subway.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: Where are you headed with this?

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: Your mood affects the quality of your work,, which, in turn, affects me.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: I would like to become a resource to you, for improving your personal life.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: Do you agree that you need someone in your life, Lemon?

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: No, I have bigger things to worry about, than my personal life.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: I would think that a single woman's biggest worry, would be choking to death alone in her apartment.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: I have a friend in town I'd like to set you up with.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: No, thank you.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: Thomas is very bright, has a wonderful sense of humor.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: I think it's a good match. Are you free on Thursday?

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: No, Thursday is poker night,, and, by the way, it is completely inappropriate, for you to be questioning me about my private life, and then trying to set me up with someone, when you don't even know anything about me.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: Poker night? Who plays?

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: Really, that's all you got out of that?

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: I enjoy poker. I'd be interested in seeing my new employees, under that kind of pressure.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: You're not gonna come to our crappy poker game, are you?

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: No, I'm not.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: Good.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: I bluffed. Yes, I am coming.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: 3 can't go here. 3 can't go here. Can't go here. It can go here.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: Fine, I'll meet your friend.

01x02.name: Pete
01x02.line: So, who is this Thomas guy?

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: Oh, I don't know. He's one of Jack's friends.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: Oh, my God, isn't Jack friends with Tom DeLay?

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: Am I going on a date with Tom DeLay?

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: Oh, why did I say I would do this?

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: I haven't been on a date since Dennis and I broke up, and that was almost a year ago.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: It's gonna be a complete disaster.

01x02.name: Pete
01x02.line: It's just one date. But if it is Tom DeLay and you do go home with him,, be prepared for it to get weird.

01x02.name: Tracy
01x02.line: Josh, you and me, Thursday night. I know this guy that runs an underground bird fight.

01x02.name: Josh
01x02.line: Oh, yeah. I can't do that. Thursday's poker night here.

01x02.name: PA
01x02.line: Guys, we just need to try the green-screen stuff, one more time.

01x02.name: Tracy
01x02.line: Poker night? I love poker!

01x02.name: Tracy
01x02.line: I used to play all kinds of poker with my aunts... Crazy 7, Albuquerque Freak-Out, One-Card Stud.

01x02.name: Josh
01x02.line: Yeah, I don't think those are real games.

01x02.name: Tracy
01x02.line: Whatever. Get ready to get took.

01x02.name: Frank
01x02.line: No, Mom, I can't make it Friday. I got to work.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: Hey, Frank?

01x02.name: Frank
01x02.line: Hold on.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: Yeah? What do guys like?

01x02.name: Frank
01x02.line: Uh, porn.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: No, I mean, if you were gonna go on a date with a woman,, how would you want her to act?

01x02.name: Frank
01x02.line: Like she was in a porn.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: Hey, Lemon... you're on for 8:00 for dinner at Caf√© des Artistes.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: Really? Wow.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: What? What are you gonna wear?

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: This, probably. I don't have time to go home.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: No, that won't do.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: I want you to go out on your lunch hour, and find something... in a women's clothing store.

01x02.name: Tracy
01x02.line: Remind me what's better,, a pair of black aces or a pair of red aces.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: You guys, I'm leaving.

01x02.name: Writers
01x02.line: Whoo-hoo!

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: All right, all right.

01x02.name: Pete
01x02.line: Hey, look at you! You look like a fancy prostitute.

01x02.name: Pete
01x02.line: Okay, I got my chair. I got my beer. I got my lucky doughnut.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: Oh, is there room for one more?

01x02.name: Pete
01x02.line: Yeah, sure. Really?

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: That's fantastic.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: Could we just, uh, this. Ah, yes, yes, yes.

01x02.name: Tracy
01x02.line: Donaghy, what up?

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: What up, Tra?

01x02.name: Tracy
01x02.line: This round, Texas Doozy. Face cards are wild, 3 is a jinx, 5s are 2s.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: Tra, do you mind if I deal this hand?

01x02.name: Tracy
01x02.line: Be my guest. Show me love.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: Ladies and gentlemen, the minimum bet in this game is $25.

01x02.name: Pete
01x02.line: Oh, Jack, we usually just play for quarters.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: Well, then you best go home and put on your daddy's shoes, boy. This is a man's game.

01x02.name: Pete
01x02.line: Okay. I call.

01x02.name: Frank
01x02.line: And I'll see that with this thing.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: I call.

01x02.name: Pete
01x02.line: Pair of jacks.

01x02.name: Frank
01x02.line: Ace-high.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: Three cowboys.

01x02.name: Pete
01x02.line: Oh, my God, my wedding ring. Oh, my God. Oh, my God. Oh, my God.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: Now, you should all learn from Pete's mistake.

01x02.name: Pete
01x02.line: My wife's gonna k*ll me!

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: You see, in poker, as in business, the key to success, is to determine your opponent's strength, and, more importantly, his weaknesses.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: Everyone has a tell... a weakness of character that manifests itself physically.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: Like, when Lutz here has a good hand, he stops eating.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: When Frank is bluffing, he asks a series of inane questions, to hide his nervousness.

01x02.name: Frank
01x02.line: Oh, really, is that what you think? Is that what I do? Am I doing that right now?

01x02.name: Frank
01x02.line: Yeah, I'm out.

01x02.name: Tracy
01x02.line: Okay, Rain Man, tell me what I got.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: Well, you have two of your cards backwards, actually.

01x02.name: Tracy
01x02.line: I'm out.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: Hi, Pinot Grigio, please.

01x02.name: Waiter
01x02.line: Mm-hmm.

01x02.name: Toofer
01x02.line: This is beyond the pale. Donaghy took me for $200.

01x02.name: Frank
01x02.line: Yeah, well, I bet my rent money,, and if I don't pay by the 10th, my mom's gonna throw me out.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: I'm all-in. Anybody else?

01x02.name: Kenneth
01x02.line: Oh, I'll play with you, Mr. Donaghy.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: Kenneth, how long you been sitting there?

01x02.name: Kenneth
01x02.line: I'm taking Pete's place, 'cause he's busy in the bathroom,, laying in his own sick.

01x02.name: Frank
01x02.line: Oh, my God. He can't read Kenneth. He's a blank slate.

01x02.name: Jack
01x02.line: Okay, what do you got?

01x02.name: Kenneth
01x02.line: I think I have what they refer to as a royal flush.

01x02.name: Kenneth
01x02.line: Looks like I'm the big winner.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: Thank you.

01x02.name: Thomas
01x02.line: Liz?

01x02.name: Thomas
01x02.line: Hi, I'm Gretchen Thomas, Jack's friend.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: Hey.

01x02.name: Thomas
01x02.line: Great to meet you. Hi.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: Why would Jack just assume that we're lesbians?

01x02.name: Thomas
01x02.line: I am a lesbian.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: Mmm, that's awesome.

01x02.name: Thomas
01x02.line: Is this the first time, somebody's made that assumption about you?

01x02.name: Coach
01x02.line: Lemon, don't let these girls give you a hard time, about who you are.

01x02.name: Dentist
01x02.line: You know, you need to brush your teeth more, young man.

01x02.name: Elderly Woman
01x02.line: Oh, my, what an adorable little lesbian.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: What? I don't know. Who remembers that kind of thing?

01x02.name: Thomas
01x02.line: Oh, well, look, obviously, this is a miscommunication. I'm certainly not interested in chasing a straight girl.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: Of course, yeah.

01x02.name: Thomas
01x02.line: I completely understand if you just want to go home.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: No, it's fine. I'll stay.

01x02.name: Liz
01x02.line: Jack is ridiculous.

01x02.name: Thomas
01x02.line: Oh, I worked with Jack in plastics.

01x02.name: Thomas
01x02.line: He tends to approach everything the same way... locate the problem, isolate the problem,, set the problem up with a lesbian.
That's a pretty good joke for somebody from plastics.
Well, I wasn't always in plastics.
I used to work in water-process technologies,, working mainly in primary metals.
Oh, so you have a comedy background?
How was your evening with Thomas?
You mean Gretchen Thomas,, the brilliant plastics engineer/lesbian?
What made you think I was gay?
Your shoes.
Well, I'm straight.
Those shoes are definitely bi-curious.
Regardless, I am straight... 100% completely straight.
Well, I'm sorry if I offended you.
No, I'm not offended. Good.
What do you know about Kenneth, the page?
I don't know. He's a sweet kid.
Yes, and a surprisingly good poker player.
Did you know that his middle name is Ellen?
No, that's weird.
That his Myers-Briggs psychological testing, shows a rare combination, of extroverted, intuitive, and aggressive?
Really? It's the same as mine.
He could be trouble down the line.
Kenneth? Kenneth Ellen.
All right, then, you're not a lesbian... duly noted.
I'll correct that on your file.
It's too bad, though. Thomas thought you were great.
She did?
Yes.
She said she thought you looked like Jennifer Jason Leigh.
Really, she said that?
Yes, I made her repeat it.
I was sure she meant Jason Lee.
Jenna, set yourself, please,, for "Dancing with the Deity.", Miss Lemon? Yes?
This is Pete's wedding ring.
I won it last night, but I don't think I should keep it.
Could you give it back to him for me? Yeah, okay.
Did you win this, too?
I did.
I love how the light catches it like diamonds.
Kenneth, it is diamonds.
Ah, hi, Mr. Donaghy.
Can I help you with something?
You are a puzzle, Kenneth Ellen.
And I'm going to solve you.
Yes, I am.
I can't believe you bet your wedding ring. I know.
Weird thing is, I had money left.
Hey, um, what famous person would you say I look like?
Uh, present-day Linda Ronstadt.
No, Ruth Bader Ginsburg. Tootsie.
Oh, never mind.
So, how was your date?
It wasn't a good match.
What happened? Did he notice your facial tic?
No.
Did you wear sandals? Did he see your toes?
No. You blew it, didn't you?
Good job, Liz. Way to go.
Another one bites the dust.
Aw, look at your little face.
It was a lady!
Are you serious?
Oh!
Where is my Emmy?
Deal or no deal?
This is not the time to leave yet.
I don't feel it's the time to leave yet.
I'm gonna say no deal.
No deal.
Hello?
Hi, Gretchen. It's Liz Lemon.
Oh, hi.
Look, this is gonna sound really weird,, but, um, do you ever worry about choking to death alone, in your apartment?
Oh, it's so weird you would say that.
I think about it all the time.
I mean, you'd die, and they wouldn't find you, until your neighbor's dog smelled you from the hallway.
Oh, yes, and they'd show a picture of you on "NY1.", , <script>(adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});</script>, And it's not just choking.
Ever since I turned 30,, every time I get in or out of the bathtub,, I think in my head, "Careful, careful.", Yes! Oh!
Everything's the worst.
Do you want to get some dinner?
Sure.
I'll see you in 20 at Neptune. Yeah, okay,, Oh!
Oh, oh, oh! I can't...
I did not die.
Man, this is amazing.
Oh, hey, Jack.
Welcome. Welcome, everybody.
Damn, Jack, you went all-out. That's a giant shrimp.
Made out of shrimp and diving into a bowl of shrimp.
Please, enjoy, Tracy. Hey, Pete, good to see you.
Jack. Is Kenneth here?
I... I will check.
I've been playing for two hours.
I'm tired of losing.
I'm gonna let my boy Dot Com play a hand for me.
So, hey, Dot Com, are we going to those three clubs tonight?
You know, the doctor said I have four hearts in my body?
All right.
Come on.
Damn it.
What the...
Hey, everybody, this is Gretchen.
Oh, hey.
Thomas.
Jack.
How's everybody up there? We miss you.
I love this woman.
Let's play some poker.
I call.
What have you got, Kenneth?
All clovers. I win.
Very clever boy, Kenneth,, but the curtain has been drawn back now,, and I know the real you.
I think he's confusing me with someone else.
Liz, are you sure you're not gay?
Because that chick is hot.
We're just friends, like Oprah and Gayle.
Why is that so hard for everybody to believe?
She's great. You should marry that girl.
Yeah, one problem... I'm not gay.
Oh, Lemon, in the 10 years that I've known you,, you've had some really terrible boyfriends.
I have.
There was the guy who was obsessed with Charlie Chaplin. Neil.
There was the guy who played Halo under the name Slut Banger. Dennis.
There was a tall, gangly, red-haired guy, who played guitar all the time.
Conan.
You're more relaxed with Gretchen, than you were with any of those guys.
So, what are you saying, Pete, I should just be a lesbian?
Oh, I'm not saying it'll be easy.
You know, get drunk first.
Why do guys think women can just flip a switch like that?
What if I said to you, "Go be with Frank now"?
Ah, I would be honored.
Frank is a very tender, beautiful man.
He's awesome.
You can't read his thoughts 'cause he doesn't have any.
I raise you $200.
And I see your $200 and raise you $300.
Will you,, little Kenneth Ellen Parcell from Stone Mountain, Georgia,, growing up in your mama's tract house,, dreaming of working on a TV show,, dreaming of making it all the way to the NBC?
You're scaring me, Mr. Donaghy.
You've come a long way, haven't you, Kenneth Ellen,, with your cheap loafers and your page jacket?
But you'll always be a pig farmer's son, boy,, 'cause I smell fried bologna all over you.
I'm all-in.
I'm out of chips, Mr. Donaghy.
Hey, I got a fun idea.
You put your page jacket on the table.
And if you win, you can get it back.
If you lose... you go on home.
You go on home, little Kenneth Ellen...
all the way to Stone Mountain.
Go for it!
He's bluffing!
Do it!
Test yourself.
Don't do it.
I've got a pair of 2s.
Well, let's just seeby-weeby here.
I've got a 2, a 4,, a 9, a 6, and a king.
That means I win.
Kenneth, why did you bet that terrible hand?
Why?
Because I believe that life is for the living.
I believe in taking risks, and biting off more than you can chew.
And, also, people were yelling,, and I got confused about the rules.
Kenneth?
I wasn't really going to fire you.
I just wanted to remind you that I could.
I want you back here at 6:00 in the morning sharp, so you can sweep up these shrimp tails.
Yes, sir, Mr. Donaghy.
Uh, I'm gonna have my eye on you, Kenneth.
You will not be disappointed, sir.
Well, it was nice of you to let him keep his job.
The Italians have a saying, Lemon.
"Keep your friends close and your enemies closer.", And although they've never won a war, or mass-produced a decent car,, in this area, they are correct.
In five years, we'll all either be working for him...
...or be dead by his hand.
Hey, after IKEA tomorrow,, you want to go see Margaret Cho at the Beacon?
Oh, boy, uh, Oprah?
Yes, Gayle?
I think we need to take a break.
Because I wanted to submit us for "The Amazing Race"?
Because I was 80% joking about that.
No, it's...
You know, I said I'm not into chasing straight girls,, and I kind of think that's what's starting to happen here.
So, unless you're ready to make a big life change,, I need to move on, find my Stedman.
I thought I was Oprah in this metaphor.
Also, you're gay, so that's a little confusing.
You should say, like, "my lady Stedman.", Okay, I'm going out on a limb here.
Okay, sorry, um, it's just, uh,, if I try to imagine us being together,, I think, "Yeah, okay, this could be fun.", You know, picking out furniture, and making flowerbeds out of old railroad ties.
But the thing is,, if I'm gonna be with someone, it has to be a guy.
You sound pretty sure about that.
What can I say?
I love a bald spot and a hairy back.
You're alone there.
I should go.
I'll see you around.
Okay, wait, um, what if we made a pact?
What if we say that in, like, 25 years,, if neither of us has someone,, we'll move in together and be roommates?
And even though I am not into the s*x stuff,, if it helps you,, I would let you do stuff to me.
I can't be around you anymore.
Bye, Liz.
That's funny. That's what the guys always say.
Who's gonna go with me to cooking class next weekend?
Well, if by "cooking class" you mean your bed, and by "next weekend" you mean tonight...
Oh, shut up.
I can see your wedding ring.
Idiot.
